ygData.msgSnippet: ... Are you doing fast checkpointing ?  If not, you might want to consider it particularly since you re crawling big. Are you saying that under the checkpoint

joehung302 wrote:
> 
>  >
>  > > I did a checkpoint and of course, failed.
>  >
>  > What was the exception?
> 
> It never completed. I started the checkpoint @ 6:00PM last night.
> didn't see bdb-je directory nor the manifest file.

Are you doing 'fast checkpointing'?  If not, you might want to consider 
it particularly since you're crawling big.

Are you saying that under the checkpoint directory, there was no 
directory named bdbje-logs that we were filling with the *.jdb bdbje log 
content from the job state directory?  In future you might take a 
threaddump or two to get a clue as to where the crawler is stuck.


> 
>  >
>  > > I have a bout 30
>  > > errors like this over the past week on this crawl and eventually
> I
>  > > got that Cursor closed error then about 10 OOME after that.
>  > >
> 
>  >
>  > You think it because of the OOME?  Are they concurrent?
>  >
>  >
> 
> These are the warnings: After "cursor has been closed" the warnings
> are all OOME. Before "Cursor has been closed" all warnings are the
> file reading problem that I mentioned above.

So the 'Cursor has been closed' and the OOMEs (assuming the top listed 
SEVEREs are OOMEs) look to be fairly concurrent.  The 'Cursor' SEVERE 
happens 8 seconds or so before the first OOME (The bulk of the 8 seconds 
could have been spent in a Full GC stalling the crawler while the JVM 
scrambled to find mem). So I'm guessing the latter is the likely cause 
of the former (Bdbje folks wrote again.  What size bdbje cache are you 
using?).

St.Ack


>
